meanings.definition: A substance used to darken or blacken something.
meanings.sent1: The blackeners were carefully applied to the wood to give it a rich, dark color.
meanings.sent2: The painter used blackeners to create a dramatic effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child thought the blackeners were magic potions and tried to use them on his toys.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds acted as natural blackeners, casting a shadow over the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The blackeners transformed the appearance of the old furniture, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: People who darken or blacken something.
meanings.sent1: The blackeners in the workshop were skilled artisans who specialized in creating antique finishes.
meanings.sent2: The blackeners at the factory worked tirelessly to meet the demand for dark-colored fabrics.
meanings.sent3: The blackeners at the barbecue competition were known for their secret sauce recipe.
meanings.sent4: The blackeners in the movie industry added depth and emotion to the film scenes.
meanings.sent5: The blackeners in the theater troupe brought a sense of mystery to the stage production.

meanings.definition: The act of darkening or blackening something.
meanings.sent1: The blackeners of the metal were done using a special chemical process.
meanings.sent2: The gradual blackeners of the sky signaled the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The accidental blackeners of the cake made it look like a burnt offering.
meanings.sent4: The blackeners of the forest canopy created a cool, shady retreat.
meanings.sent5: The deliberate blackeners of the photo gave it a vintage, timeless feel.
